channel.title: My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Learnjavascript02
item.description: Let we build a calculator on the browser desgin the web page by HTML html=' \ <div> \ <input type="text" id="inputBox" value="0"> \ <button type="button" id="addSign">+</button> \ <button type="button" id="subtractSign">-</button> \ <button type="button" id="multiplySign">*</button> \ <button type="button" id="divideSign">/</button> \ <button type="button" id="equalSign">=</button> \ <button type="button" id="cleanSign">Clean</button> \ </div>'; document.body.innerHTML = html; Add, subtract, multiply and divide function sum(a1, a2){ return a1+a2; } function substract(a1, a2){ return a1-a2; } function multiply(a1, a2){ return a1*a2; } function divide(a1, a2){ var tmp = a1/a2; return isNaN(tmp)?

item.title: Learnjavascript01
item.description: Learn Javascript for beginner. Open your chrome browser, amd press key “F12”. You will see the develop tool, And look for the console panel. Then you can writting code in the panel now. alert('Hello world'); Do you see the alert box? let’s to next step Scope var a = 1; console.log(a); print: 1 Some of code about function. function test(){ var b = 1; return b; } console.log(b); console.log(test); console.log(test()); print: Uncaught ReferenceError: b is not defined
